ygData.msgSnippet: Tucson looks to Mach Kick and gently gets back to all fours to let him down.  Sorry about that.  I guess I really got into my training exercises .  Good thing

Tucson looks to Mach Kick and gently gets back to all fours to let him down=
.

" Sorry about that.  I guess I really got into my training exercises .  =
Good thing you spoke up."

He then turns to face Big Convoy.

" Master Yoki=
tron trained me in both forms and then he took me aside and trained me a bi=
t further than what was normally taught in training academy.  Nightshift wa=
s trained along side with me, and not too many bots were given the opportun=
ity that we were given.  I feel a bit incomplete, like as if I'm missing a =
component of myself.  I always fought with Nightshift beside me and togethe=
r we would defeat our opponents.  And if Magmatron is believed to have such=
 training, I will have to work extra hard to keep my head above water.  I k=
now I can combat Rodimus but I'm not so sure I can defeat Magmatron.   Prim=
us help us if he challenges me. Not much scares me but, going against an im=
possible foe, does."

Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. 

On Oct=
 7, 2011, at 2:42 PM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> > =
<OLD>
> >
> > Tucson remains still with a light hearted grin on his muzzle.=

> >
> > " Of course my friend, I was just toying with them, nothing seriou=
s. Now, a
> > lot of my skills in combat revolve around balance, poise, foc=
us and most
> > important, inner peace. Such was the teachings of Master Yo=
kitron. Which I
> > really should be continuing. Mach Kick, you can stay on=
 my back, just be
> > sure to hold onto me securely. I'm going to warm up w=
ith some basic
> > exercises in balance. And I think I would like to contin=
ue in beast mode. "
> >
> > He slowly gets up on his hind legs, standing in=
 a near erect position.
> > Instead of curling his front legs into his ches=
t, he stretches them out and
> > begins his exercises. A look of serenity c=
omes over his face as his front
> > legs work as arms and hands, in a grace=
ful dance of poise and tranquility.
> > Slowly, his hind legs and feet begi=
n to move gracefully in unison with his
> > upper body. As his tail moves w=
ith his body, a gentile breeze is kicked up
> > in it's wake. He minds his =
feet and moves carefully around his new friends.
> > It was his way of trai=
ning for battle. The more he moves the faster his
> > arms and legs move as=
 swift taloned hands perform the same functions as they
> > were if he were=
 in robot mode. And then the dance blossoms into an
> > impressive display =
of martial arts as the Silver Dragon performs a stellar
> > spin/ revolving=
 kick maneuver. He lands on his feet without a wobble in his
> > legs or an=
kles. He turns his head to see if Mach Kick was still on his
> > back.
> >
=
> > " The reason why I chose to warm up this way is because typically, no o=
ne
> > expects a transformer to fight that way in alt form. When I first me=
t
> > Master Yokitron, he asked me to do something completely out of the no=
rmal
> > routine of combat training. I was an Autobot back then and he aske=
d me to
> > remain in vehicle form during the first lesson. I thought he wa=
s kidding
> > but he wasn't. So then he asked me to drive a little down a r=
oad that he
> > sanctioned for Autobot training. I went down that road and =
suddenly, I
> > found myself on two wheels instead of four. I was an SUV at=
 the time and I
> > was shocked clear out of my suspension cables when I we=
nt up on my left
> > front and rear tires. There was a ramp under me and I =
did not expect it.
> > But then he said that even a bulky vehicle can find =
balance. And if a bulky
> > vehicle can find balance, so can a dragon. This=
 is what I'm going to try
> > and convey in the battle field."
> 
> <NEW>
>=
 
> There was a nod of comprehension from BIG CONVOY as he watched TUSCON.
=
> "I have heard of your master Yokitron." He said as he folded his
> massiv=
e arms over his chest. "I am told his students are well trained
> in variou=
s styles of fighting including Circuit-Su and Metallikato."
> 
> As BIG tal=
ked MACH KICK said, "Hey, I'm still up here ya know!" He
> said as held on =
for dear life as TUSCON continued his training.
> 
> "I think Magmatron has=
 some sort of similar training." BIG CONVOY said
> with a frown, sseming to=
 ignore MACH KICK for the moment. "I have seen
> him fight once or twice."
=
>

<html><body bgcolor=3D"#FFFFFF"><div>Tucson looks to Mach Kick and gently g=
ets back to all fours to let him down.</div><div><br></div><div>" Sorry abo=
ut that.  I guess I really got into my training exercises .  Good=
 thing you spoke up."</div><div><br></div><div>He then turns to face Big Co=
nvoy.</div><div><br></div><div>" Master Yokitron trained me in both forms a=
nd then he took me aside and trained me a bit further than what was normall=
y taught in training academy.  Nightshift was trained along side with =
me, and not too many bots were given the opportunity that we were given. &n=
bsp;I feel a bit incomplete, like as if I'm missing a component of myself. =
 I always fought with Nightshift beside me and together we would defea=
t our opponents.  And if Magmatron is believed to have such training, =
I will have to work extra hard to keep my head above water.  I know I =
can combat Rodimus but I'm not so sure I can defeat Magmatron.   Primu=
s help us if he challenges me. Not much scares me but, going against an imp=
ossible foe, does."</div><div><br>Perpetually on the move and constantly bu=
sy. </div><div><br>On Oct 7, 2011, at 2:42 PM, Super Cyclonus <<a h=
ref=3D"mailto:supercyclonus@...">supercyclonus@...</a>> wrot=
e:<br><br></div><div></div><blockquote type=3D"cite"><div>

    <div id=3D"ygrp-text">

      <p>> <OLD><br>
><br>
> Tucson remains still with a li=
ght hearted grin on his muzzle.<br>
><br>
> " Of course my friend, I =
was just toying with them, nothing serious.  Now, a<br>
> lot of my skil=
ls in combat revolve around balance, poise, focus and most<br>
> importa=
nt, inner peace.  Such was the teachings of Master Yokitron.  Which I<br>
&=
gt; really should be continuing.  Mach Kick, you can stay on my back, just =
be<br>
> sure to hold onto me securely.   I'm going to warm up with some=
 basic<br>
> exercises in balance.  And I think I would like to continue=
 in beast mode. "<br>
><br>
> He slowly gets up on his hind legs, sta=
nding in a near erect position.<br>
> Instead of curling his front legs =
into his chest, he stretches them out and<br>
> begins his exercises.   =
A look of serenity comes over his face as his front<br>
> legs work as a=
rms and hands, in a graceful dance of poise and tranquility.<br>
> Slowl=
y, his hind legs and feet begin to move gracefully in unison with his<br>
&=
gt; upper body.  As his tail moves with his body, a gentile breeze is kicke=
d up<br>
> in it's wake. He minds his feet and moves carefully around hi=
s new friends.<br>
> It was his way of training for battle.  The more he=
 moves the faster his<br>
> arms and legs move as swift taloned hands pe=
rform the same functions as they<br>
> were if he were in robot mode.  A=
nd then the dance blossoms into an<br>
> impressive display of martial a=
rts as the Silver Dragon performs a stellar<br>
> spin/ revolving kick m=
aneuver.  He lands on his feet without a wobble in his<br>
> legs or ank=
les.  He turns his head to see if Mach Kick was still on his<br>
> back.=
<br>
><br>
> " The reason why I chose to warm up this way is because =
typically, no one<br>
> expects a transformer to fight that way in alt f=
orm.  When I first met<br>
> Master Yokitron, he asked me to do somethin=
g completely out of the normal<br>
> routine of combat training.  I was =
an Autobot back then and he asked me to<br>
> remain in vehicle form dur=
ing the first lesson.  I thought he was kidding<br>
> but he wasn't. So =
then he asked me to drive a little down a road that he<br>
> sanctioned =
for Autobot training.  I went down that road and suddenly, I<br>
> found=
 myself on two wheels instead of four.  I was an SUV at the time and I<br>
=
> was shocked clear out of my suspension cables when I went up on my lef=
t<br>
> front and rear tires.   There was a ramp under me and I did not =
expect it.<br>
> But then he said that even a bulky vehicle can find bal=
ance.  And if a bulky<br>
> vehicle can find balance, so can a dragon.  =
This is what I'm going to try<br>
> and convey in the battle field."<br>=

<br>
<NEW><br>
<br>
There was a nod of comprehension from BIG CONVOY=
 as he watched TUSCON.<br>
"I have heard of your master Yokitron." He said =
as he folded his<br>
massive arms over his chest. "I am told his students a=
re well trained<br>
in various styles of fighting including Circuit-Su and =
Metallikato."<br>
<br>
As BIG talked MACH KICK said, "Hey, I'm still up her=
e ya know!" He<br>
said as held on for dear life as TUSCON continued his tr=
aining.<br>
<br>
"I think Magmatron has some sort of similar training." BIG=
 CONVOY said<br>
with a frown, sseming to ignore MACH KICK for the moment. =
"I have seen<br>
him fight once or twice."<br>
